archetype_name: Family Turkish & North African Suppers (Medium, 30–60, Intermediate)
name: Lamb Kofta & Apricot Tomato Sauce with Preserved Lemon Almond Couscous
description: Baked lamb kofta simmered in a gently spiced tomato–apricot sauce, served over fluffy couscous with toasted almonds and preserved lemon. Medium warmth, Turkish–North African inspired family supper.
prep_steps: Heat oven to 200°C/400°F. Line a baking tray with foil and lightly oil.
Finely chop onions (1 medium) and garlic (4 cloves).
Roughly chop apricot (8–10 pieces) and preserved lemon (1/2), removing any seeds.
Chop parsley (small handful) and mint (small handful), keeping a little for garnish.
In a bowl, mix lamb mince with half the chopped onions, half the garlic, parsley, 1 tsp baharat, 1/2 tsp cumin, 1/4 tsp cinnamon, 1/2 tsp chili flakes, 1 tsp salt, and 1/2 tsp black pepper.
Shape the lamb mixture into 12–16 small kofta (oval meatballs).
Measure couscous (1.5 cups) into a heatproof bowl.
Set out almonds (1/3 cup, roughly chopped).
cook_steps: Toast almonds: spread on a small tray and bake 5–7 minutes until golden; set aside.
Bake kofta: place shaped kofta on the oiled tray and bake 10–12 minutes until browned and just cooked; keep warm.
Start sauce: heat 2 tbsp olive oil in a wide pan over medium heat. Sauté remaining onions with a pinch of salt for 5 minutes until translucent.
Add remaining garlic, 1 tsp baharat, 1/2 tsp cumin, a pinch of cinnamon, and 1/2 tsp chili flakes; cook 30 seconds until fragrant.
Stir in crushed tomatoes (1 can), chopped apricot, 1 tbsp apricot jam (optional for balance), and 1/2 cup water. Simmer 8–10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Season sauce with salt and black pepper to taste. Gently nestle baked kofta into the sauce and simmer 5 minutes to coat and glaze.
Make couscous: bring 1.5 cups vegetable stock (or water) to a boil. Pour over couscous bowl, cover tightly, and rest 5 minutes. Fluff with a fork.
Fold into couscous: toasted almonds, chopped preserved lemon, mint, 1 tbsp olive oil, and a pinch of salt and black pepper.
Serve: spoon couscous onto plates, top with kofta and apricot tomato sauce. Garnish with reserved herbs.
